Varus (Default)

RP Cost: N/A

Release Date: N/A

Varus, the Arrow of Retribution, is a powerful marksman in the popular online game League of Legends. As one of the original champions released in the game, Varus has become a fan-favorite due to his unique playstyle and intriguing lore. In this article, we will delve into the story behind Varus's default skin and explore all the intricate details of this iconic costume.

The Story of Varus's Default Skin

Varus's default skin represents his original appearance when he was first introduced to the League of Legends universe. Clad in dark armor and wielding his signature bow, Varus embodies the essence of vengeance and retribution. The skin features intricate details, such as the glowing green energy emanating from his bow and the ornate designs on his armor. The combination of dark hues and vibrant accents creates a visually striking and intimidating presence on the battlefield.

The default skin perfectly captures Varus's lore and character. According to his backstory, Varus was once a skilled Ionian archer named Kai, who lived a peaceful life with his family. However, tragedy struck when Noxian invaders attacked his village, killing his loved ones. Consumed by grief and seeking revenge, Kai made a pact with a dark entity known as the Darkin, which merged with him, transforming him into Varus.

The default skin reflects Varus's dual nature, with the dark energy of the Darkin intertwining with his mortal form. The glowing green energy that emanates from his bow represents the corruption and power bestowed upon him by the Darkin. The intricate designs on his armor symbolize the ancient and mystical origins of his newfound abilities. Overall, the default skin serves as a visual representation of Varus's tragic past and his unwavering pursuit of vengeance.

Varus's Strengths and Weaknesses

In the game, Varus is known for his long-range poke and high burst damage. His abilities allow him to harass enemies from a safe distance, making him a formidable threat in the laning phase. Varus's Q ability, Piercing Arrow, can deal massive damage if charged up, while his E ability, Hail of Arrows, provides area-of-effect damage and crowd control. Additionally, his ultimate, Chain of Corruption, can immobilize multiple enemies, setting up opportunities for his team to secure kills.

However, Varus also has his weaknesses. Due to his immobility, he is vulnerable to assassins and champions with high mobility. If caught out of position, Varus can easily be taken down by champions who can close the gap quickly. Additionally, his lack of escape tools makes him reliant on his team for protection. Varus players must position themselves carefully and rely on their team's peel and crowd control to survive in team fights.

Varus's Place in the Game

Varus has found his place as a popular pick in both professional and casual play. His long-range poke and ability to shred tanks make him a valuable asset in team compositions. Varus's ultimate, Chain of Corruption, is a game-changing ability that can initiate team fights or disengage from unfavorable engagements. His versatility allows him to be played in both the bottom lane as an ADC (Attack Damage Carry) and in the mid lane as a mage.

Furthermore, Varus's lore and character have resonated with players, making him a beloved champion in the League of Legends community. His tragic backstory and his unwavering pursuit of vengeance have captured the imaginations of players, adding depth and emotional connection to his gameplay experience.

Explore Varus's Appearances

If you want to learn more about Varus and his various appearances in the game, you can find detailed information and videos on our dedicated Varus page. Discover the different skins available for Varus, each with its own unique theme and visual effects. From the hauntingly beautiful Arclight Varus to the menacing Dark Star Varus, there is a skin to suit every player's taste.

Varus's default skin may be his original appearance, but the League of Legends universe offers a plethora of options to customize his look and enhance your gaming experience. Visit our Varus page to unlock the full potential of this iconic champion and immerse yourself in the world of League of Legends.

Varus: The Arrow of Retribution

Release Date: April 10, 2012

Varus, the Arrow of Retribution, is a powerful marksman in the popular online game League of Legends. With his deadly bow and a thirst for vengeance, Varus brings a unique playstyle to the game, combining long-range attacks with crowd control abilities. In this article, we will delve into Varus' story, his strengths and weaknesses, his background in the game, and his place in the League of Legends universe.

Background Story

Varus' tale is one of tragedy and revenge. Once a proud Ionian archer, he was corrupted by the dark magic known as the Darkin. Varus was a guardian of an ancient temple, entrusted with protecting a powerful artifact called the Pit of Pallas. However, when Noxian forces invaded Ionia, Varus was forced to make a difficult choice. He left his post to defend his homeland, only to return and find the temple destroyed and his loved ones slain.

Consumed by grief and anger, Varus succumbed to the Darkin's influence, merging with the bow and becoming a vessel of vengeance. Now, he seeks to exact retribution upon those who wronged him, using his newfound powers to rain down destruction upon his enemies.

Strengths and Weaknesses

Varus possesses a unique set of strengths and weaknesses that make him a formidable champion on the Fields of Justice. His long-range abilities allow him to poke and harass enemies from a safe distance, making him a strong laner in the bottom lane. His Q ability, Piercing Arrow, can deal massive damage to multiple targets if charged up, making it a potent tool for team fights and sieges.

Furthermore, Varus' E ability, Hail of Arrows, provides him with crowd control and area denial, making it difficult for enemies to engage or disengage from fights. This ability can also be used to slow down enemies, allowing Varus and his team to secure kills or escape dangerous situations.

However, Varus does have his weaknesses. As a squishy marksman, he is vulnerable to assassins and burst damage champions who can quickly close the gap and eliminate him. Additionally, Varus lacks mobility, making him an easy target for crowd control effects and skillshots. Players must position themselves carefully and rely on their team to peel for them in order to survive in team fights.

Varus in the Game

Varus is primarily played as an ADC (Attack Damage Carry) in the bottom lane, alongside a support champion. His long-range abilities and high damage output make him a strong pick for players who enjoy a more strategic and calculated playstyle. Varus players must focus on farming minions to accumulate gold and experience, as well as positioning themselves safely in team fights to maximize their damage output.

Varus' ultimate ability, Chain of Corruption, is a game-changer in team fights. It can root multiple enemies in place, allowing Varus and his team to follow up with devastating damage. Properly timing and landing this ability can turn the tide of battle and secure victory for his team.

Furthermore, Varus has a variety of skins available, each with its own unique theme and visual effects. Players can access information and videos of all Varus skins on this page, allowing them to choose their favorite and customize their in-game experience.

In conclusion, Varus is a powerful marksman with a tragic backstory and a thirst for vengeance. His long-range abilities, crowd control, and high damage output make him a formidable force on the Fields of Justice. However, players must be mindful of his weaknesses and play strategically to maximize his potential. Whether you're a fan of his lore or enjoy his playstyle, Varus is a champion worth exploring in the world of League of Legends.

Varus (Arclight Varus)

RP: 1350 | Release Date: August 14, 2014

Varus, the Arrow of Retribution, has long been a formidable force on the Fields of Justice. With his deadly bow and piercing arrows, he strikes fear into the hearts of his enemies. However, there is a side to Varus that many are not aware of - a side that embodies purity and righteousness. This side is represented by his Arclight Varus skin, a celestial transformation that brings a new level of awe-inspiring beauty to the champion.

Arclight Varus is a skin that radiates with divine energy. The once dark and brooding Varus is now bathed in a brilliant golden light, symbolizing his transformation into a celestial being. His armor is adorned with intricate patterns and glowing runes, giving him an ethereal appearance. The bow he wields is no longer a simple weapon but a celestial artifact, pulsating with power and radiating a heavenly glow. The arrows he fires leave trails of shimmering light in their wake, adding to the majestic spectacle of his attacks.

The Arclight Varus skin not only changes his appearance but also enhances his abilities. His Q ability, Piercing Arrow, now leaves a trail of golden light as it travels, making it even more visually striking. His W ability, Blighted Quiver, imbues his arrows with divine energy, causing them to explode in a burst of celestial light upon impact. His E ability, Hail of Arrows, creates a dazzling display of golden projectiles that rain down upon his enemies. Finally, his ultimate ability, Chain of Corruption, ensnares his foes in chains of pure light, immobilizing them and dealing divine damage.

Varus, the champion behind the Arclight Varus skin, has a rich lore that adds depth to his character. In the world of League of Legends, Varus was once a proud Ionian warrior who fought to protect his homeland from Noxian invaders. However, tragedy struck when he was corrupted by the dark magic of the pit. The pit's malevolent influence consumed him, turning him into a vengeful entity driven by a thirst for retribution. Now, as the Arrow of Retribution, Varus seeks to exact his revenge upon those who wronged him.

In terms of gameplay, Varus is a marksman who excels at long-range poke and burst damage. His Q ability, Piercing Arrow, allows him to charge up a powerful shot that deals massive damage to enemies in its path. His W ability, Blighted Quiver, empowers his basic attacks, causing them to deal bonus magic damage and apply a stacking debuff to enemies. His E ability, Hail of Arrows, creates an area of effect damage zone that slows enemies caught within it. Finally, his ultimate ability, Chain of Corruption, fires out a chain of corruption that immobilizes the first enemy champion hit and then spreads to nearby enemies.

Varus's strengths lie in his ability to poke from a safe distance and his ability to burst down enemies with his combo. His long-range allows him to harass opponents in lane and whittle down their health before engaging in an all-out fight. His burst damage potential is also significant, especially when he lands a fully charged Piercing Arrow followed by a basic attack empowered by Blighted Quiver. Additionally, his ultimate ability, Chain of Corruption, can be a game-changer in team fights, as it can lock down multiple enemies and set up for devastating follow-up damage.

However, Varus also has weaknesses that players must be aware of. He is relatively immobile compared to other marksmen, making him vulnerable to assassins and champions with high mobility. Varus relies heavily on landing skill shots, particularly his Q ability, which can be difficult to hit against agile opponents. Furthermore, he lacks any form of self-peel or escape mechanism, making him an easy target if caught out of position.

In the world of League of Legends, Varus holds a significant place as a powerful marksman with a tragic backstory. His Arclight Varus skin adds a touch of celestial beauty to his character, transforming him into a divine being of retribution. Whether you choose to play as the brooding Arrow of Retribution or the radiant Arclight Varus, you can find all the information and videos about Varus and his various appearances on this page.
